document_data.name: Nets Blandorf
document_data.mainbody:
'''Nets Blandorf''' was a fisherman from the [[Lower City]] of [[Baldur's Gate]] in the late 15{{th}} century [[DR]].

{{quote|How do fish even get dirty? They live in water...|Nets Blandorf}}
document_data.Description: Nets was a [[gold dwarf]] man with bronze skin tone, blue eyes, and black hair. He wore his facial hair trimmed into bushy muttonchops.
document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1492}}, as the [[Absolute crisis]] ravaged the Gate, Nets Blandorf's fishing business was damaged further by pollution of the [[Gray Harbor]]. Fishers in the Lower City continued pulling [[net]]s filled with fish covered in black [[oil]]y goo. Nets Blandorf could not understand how fish could be dirty as it came from water. He assumed that his nets were dirty and needed a good scrub so they won't dirty the catch. In reality, the fish was smothered in oil pollution left behind by a [[submersible]] used by the [[Cult of Bane]] to transport [[Lord Gortash]]'s prisoners into the drowned [[Iron Throne headquarters]] prison at the bottom of Gray Harbor.
